description: Fibonacci-type sequence based on subtraction: a(0) = 1, a(1) = 2 and a(n) = a(n-2)-a(n-1).
comments: If we drop 1 and start with 2 this is the Lucas sequence V(-1,-1). G.f.: (2+x)/(1+x-x^2). In this case a(n) is also the trace of A^(-n), where A is the Fibomatrix ((1,1), (1,0)). - Mario Catalani (mario.catalani(AT)unito.it), Aug 17 2002The positive sequence with g.f. (1+x-2x^2)/(1-x-x^2) gives the diagonal sums of the Riordan array (1+2x,x/(1-x)). - _Paul Barry_, Jul 18 2005Pisano period lengths:  1, 3, 8, 6, 4, 24, 16, 12, 24, 12, 10, 24, 28, 48, 8, 24, 36, 24, 18, 12,.... (is this A106291?). - _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 10 2012
